message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: I would like a broad overview of multiple spaceflight missions across different NASA programs, including Mercury, Gemini, Apollo, and Skylab. Please provide the mission name,  mission type, crew (astronaut) names (separated by comma), backup crew names (separated by comma), launch date (accurate to the day), launch pad, landing date (accurate to the day), landing location,  vehicle, orbit duration, and mission status (success or fail). Exclude test project in your answer.

Please organize the results in one Markdown table, the column names should be in the following order:  Mission Name, Mission Type, Crew Names, Backup Crew Names, Launch Date, Launch Pad, Landing Date, Landing Location, Vehicle, Orbit Duration, Mission Status.
Launch date and landing date should be in the yyyy-mm-dd format, such as 1999-01-01. If you cannot find the information, fill in /.

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
I need to gather information about each mission from Mercury to Skylab, excluding test projects. I'll start with the Mercury program.
</think>

<search>Mercury mission details</search>

Search query: Mercury mission details
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.nasa.gov/project-mercury/):
Project Mercury - NASA There were six total flights with six astronauts flown. Total flight time for these missions was 53 hours, 55 minutes and 27 seconds.

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Mercury):
Project Mercury - Wikipedia An early highlight of the Space Race, its goal was to put a man into Earth orbit and return him safely, ideally before the Soviet Union. Taken over from the US ...

[Doc 3](https://airandspace.si.edu/stories/editorial/what-was-mercury-program):
What was the Mercury Program? | National Air and Space Museum Project Mercury's aim was to put a man in orbit, understand the technical requirements and medical effects, and bring him back alive.

Search query: Mercury-Redstone 3 mission details
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercury-Redstone_3):
Mercury-Redstone 3 - Wikipedia Mission type, Test flight ; Operator, NASA ; Mission duration, 15 minutes, 28 seconds ; Range, 263.1 nautical miles (302.8 statute miles, 487.3 km) ; Apogee, 101.2 ...

[Doc 2](https://www.nasa.gov/mission/mercury-redstone-3-freedom-7/):
Mercury-Redstone 3: Freedom 7 - NASA The main scientific objective of project Mercury was to determine man's capabilities in a space environment and the ability to return a human safely back to ...

[Doc 3](http://www.astronautix.com/m/mercurymr-3.html):
Mercury MR-3 First American in space, less than a month after Gagarin, but only on a 15 minute suborbital flight. First manual orientation of a manned spacecraft.

Search query: Mercury Atlas 6 mission details
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercury-Atlas_6):
Mercury-Atlas 6 - Wikipedia Mercury-Atlas 6 (MA-6) was the first crewed American orbital spaceflight, which took place on February 20, 1962. Piloted by astronaut John Glenn and ...

[Doc 2](https://www.nasa.gov/missions/project-mercury/mercury-atlas-6/):
Mercury-Atlas 6 - NASA Mission Objective: Place a man into Earth orbit, observe his reactions to the space environment and safely return him to Earth to a point ...

[Doc 3](https://www.nasa.gov/mission/mercury-atlas-6-friendship-7/):
Mercury-Atlas 6: Friendship 7 - NASA An Atlas launch vehicle propelled a Mercury spacecraft into Earth orbit and enabled astronaut John Glenn to circle Earth three times.

Based on these searches, I've gathered data for two missions: Mercury-Redstone 3 and Mercury-Atlas 6. I will continue to find more data systematically.
</think>

<search>Gemini mission details</search>

Search query: Gemini mission details
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Gemini):
Project Gemini - Wikipedia The Gemini spacecraft carried a two-astronaut crew. Ten Gemini crews and 16 individual astronauts flew low Earth orbit (LEO) missions during 1965 and 1966.

[Doc 2](https://www.nasa.gov/gemini/):
Project Gemini - NASA The Gemini program was designed as a bridge between the Mercury and Apollo programs, primarily to test equipment and mission procedures in Earth orbit.

[Doc 2](https://unwritten-record.blogs.archives.gov/2025/03/25/trials-tribulations-and-a-smuggled-sandwich-the-story-of-gemini-iii/):

[Doc 3](https://airandspace.si.edu/collection-objects/capsule-gemini-3/nasm_A19710063000):
Capsule, Gemini 3 | National Air and Space Museum Gemini 3 was the first manned mission of Project Gemini, which aimed to launch a series of two-man spacecraft to test long-duration missions.

[Doc 3](https://www.planetary.org/space-missions/apollo):
